p: The statistics attest to the differential vulnerability of the young and disadvantaged. According to the World Health Organization (WHO), one-third of the existing global burden of disease is caused by environmental factors: More than 40% of that burden is borne by children < 5 years of age, although they constitute only 10% of the global population ( Smith et al. 1999; WHO 2002). Similarly, > 88% of the existing global burden of disease due to climate change also falls on children ( Zhang et al. 2007), mainly in developing countries and populations of low socioeconomic status worldwide.
